body.p: IAS 12 does not permit an enterprise to recognise certain deferred tax liabilities and assets. In such cases, some believe that the value in use of an asset, or a cash‑generating unit, should be adjusted to reflect the tax consequences of recovering its pre‑tax value in use. For example, if the tax rate is 25 per cent, an enterprise must receive pre‑tax cash flows with a present value of 400 in order to recover a carrying amount of 300.
